moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5
comment:
This is quite
common in the Stonewall Attack. White castles short and Black Long and once
the centre battle has been resolved a pawn race follows.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4
comment:
The Stonewall is established. Black can try 8...Nxe5 9.dxe5 Ne4.
This Knight can be a thorn in White's side as either the Kingside pawn
structure is weakened or the better hite squared Bishop is traded.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5
comment:
I decided it was better to keep the centre closed and try to
control the f-file.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5 Nd7 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Qf3 f6
1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5 Nd7 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Qf3 f6 13. O-O O-O-O
comment:
# White has more space and
the idea of opening the f-file looks even more appealing.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5 Nd7 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Qf3 f6 13. O-O O-O-O 14. exf6 Nxf6 15. Ng5
comment:
White normally plays Nf2 followed by e4. 15.Ng5 is a bit of a cheapo and
I was surprised by Black's reply.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5 Nd7 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Qf3 f6 13. O-O O-O-O 14. exf6 Nxf6 15. Ng5 Kd7 16. Nf7

1. d4 d5 2. e3 Nf6 3. Bd3 e6 4. Nd2 c5 5. c3 c4 6. Bc2 b5 7. Ndf3 Nc6 8. Ne5 Bb7 9. f4 Nxe5 10. fxe5 Nd7 11. Nh3 Qc7 12. Qf3 f6 13. O-O O-O-O 14. exf6 Nxf6 15. Ng5 Kd7 16. Nf7 Bd6 17. Nxh8 Bxh2+ 18. Kf2 Rxh8 19. g3 h5 20. Qf4 Qd8 21. Kg2 Ng4 22. Qf7+
comment:
Note the QR and B never moved during the game. The Stonewall might
not be everyone's cup of tea but in the right circumstances it shows what can
be done with Queen and minor pieces.
